title: Dense padding prop does not apply to EditRow
body:
**Describe the bug**
If you use the dense option, it does not affect the EditRow.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Take the basic example: https://material-table.com/#/docs/features/editable
2. Add this as options:
```
options={{
                    padding: "dense"
}}
```
3. Try to edit or delete a row
4. See that the row has default size.

 #783

**Describe the bug**
Hi,
I want to apply alternate coloring for odd and even rows in material-tabel in react application. I can successfully do it by calling my custom function , "AlternateRowColoring" when the data is loaded  but after I filter any columns the alternate coloring style function, "AlternateRowColoring" does not apply on filtered dataset. Same problem when I use search feature in material-tabel. 


**Expected behavior**
I expect that every time the dataset changes, either by filtering or by searching , the  "AlternateRowColoring" function is called and gives the alternate coloring style to the rows .

**Screenshots**
I call "AlternateRowColoring" in option in rowStyle of <MaterialTable> component:

 options={{
      rowStyle:  x =>  AlternateRowColoring(x) ,
      ...
               }}

I also tried "onFilterChange" event handler in <MaterialTable> to call "AlternateRowColoring" function, but it doesn't work as well:

onFilterChange={() =>  data.map((x, i) => (AlternateRowColoring(x))) } 

I would really appreciate it if you can help .

title: Strange actions width
No way to undertand if call to `onChangePage` was called directly or by `changePageSize`
body:
**Describe the bug**
In the last release [1.57.2](https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/releases/tag/v1.57.2)  you started to call `onChangePage` on `changePageSize`  and because of that we can't understand if we are in a new page or different pagination.

**To Reproduce**

We wanted to `scrollToTop` when page change, but we are also triggering this action now when we change the pageSize. 

**Expected behavior**

Maybe, if we pass `(page, pageSize)` to the `onChangePage` callback we will be able to understand when we are going to page 0 because the pageSize has changed or not.

title: Filter Usability
body:
After using your control for a little while now, there are some aspects of how filters are handled that I'm wondering about whether they could be implemented in a different way.  

I believe that having the filter input fields show up persistently on a separate header line of the Grid takes up a lot of screen real estate.  I'm wondering if it might be more useful to render the Filter icon to the far right hand side of the Header column next to the header label, and always render a dropdown that includes a text entry field for manually entering filters, as well as any custom ones that have been defined as the result of including a lookup property for the column.  

You could change the color of the filter icon when filters are applied, rather than listing all of the selected filters as is done today.  The current implementation does some strange resizing of the column when multiple long filter lookup items are selected.  This could be avoided by simply always providing a dropdown component for entering/managing filter values.

Also, when you have a column that has a lot of lookup values, it is not visually apparent that you can scroll down to see additional filter values that do not currently fit within the view of the filter dropdown. I think it might be better to set a minimum size of the filter dropdown that is a little larger, or try to calculate the height based on the number of lookup values specified, with a break at some defined percentage less than the remaining height of the screen.

This is a great component.  I'm really enjoying using it in my application.

title: fix(fusionjs): Fix material-core import failures
body:
## Related Issue
When using Fusion framework and material-ui installed as a plugin some of Material-table's components fail to load `withStyles` and `material-ui/core` with `Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'call' of undefined` error when calling `_interopRequireDefault(require('@material-ui/core'))` and `_interopRequireDefault(require('@material-ui/core/styles/withStyles'))`.

## Description
After hours spent to figure out the issue, I decided to try to replace `/withStyles` imports to `{ withStyles }`, and any `import {...} from '../core'` to explicit `import Something from '.../core/Something'` and then it started working again.

I may guess that inconsistent imports are somehow affecting the produced code which can't be solved by the Webpack configuration bundled with Fusion framework.

title: initialEditValue with nested fields - unexpected behavior
body:
Let's say we have a "status" column and we want the initial value to be "new".
When a column has a simple string value that is top-level, then the `initialEditValue `prop is self-explanatory and works fine.  However, if the column references a sub-field such as:

`[ ... { title:"Status", field: "shipping.from.status" ... } ... ]`

then the initial value must be given like so:

`... initialEditValue: {shipping: {from: {status: "new"}}} ...
`
because render() always gets called with the entire rowData.

All seems ok in the rendering/edit phase, until my `onAdd `is called -- the problem is that the object that gets created has a key of the nested name and then the nested object, rather than parsing the key path. For example, the `onRowAdd `callback creates the following object:

`{ ... 'shipping.from.status': {shipping: {from: {status: "new"}}} }
`
when what I expect is:

`{ ... shipping: {from: {status: "new"}}} `

Also the `emptyValue `property should really be called `renderEmptyValue `because it doesn't ask the user to supply the value to be used in case the field is empty, but to provide the rendering, correct?

`initialEditValue `is typed as `any` -- what you're looking for here is a `Partial<RowData>`, correct?
thanks

Fixes the unnecessary PropType warning in #1387
body:
## Related Issue
#1387 

## Description
Fix the warning that arises when passing a ForwardRef as an icon to `detailPanel`. If you install the material icons as listed [here in the readme](Warning: Failed prop type: Invalid prop `detailPanel`), you may run into this warning when passing an icon ForwardRef as a prop, as showed in #1387 .

## Impacted Areas in Application
List general components of the application that this PR will affect:

* `detailPanel` prop in `MaterialTable`

## Additional Notes
A current workaround to silence the warning:
```
import AccountCircle from '@material-ui/icons/AccountCircle';

      ...
      <MaterialTable
        ...
        detailPanel={[
          {
            icon: () => <AccountCircle />,  // <------------- here
            tooltip: 'Show Account',
            render: rowData => <Redirect to={`/profile/${rowData.id}`} />,
          },
        ]}
      />
```
It makes more sense though to allow `RefComponent` prop type since the other `icon` prop accepts that prop type.

title: Sending the `icons` prop directly to `TablePagination` (the default) results in bad props in the DOM
body:
[`TablePagination`](https://material-ui.com/api/table-pagination/#tablepagination-api) doesn't accept an `icons` prop, and so forwards it to [`TableCell`](https://material-ui.com/api/table-cell/).

> Any other props supplied will be provided to the root element (TableCell).

> Any other props supplied will be provided to the root element (native element).

Which causes an erroneous `icons="[object Object]"` property on the `td` DOM element.

title: Refs on icons aren't used and are typed incorrectly
body:
Firstly, I encountered incorrect typings on your icons:

```
Add?: React.ForwardRefExoticComponent<React.RefAttributes<SVGSVGElement>>;
```

It should match what `forwardRef` returns:

```
Add?: React.ForwardRefExoticComponent<any> & React.RefAttributes<SVGSVGElement>;
```

Or replace `any` with a more specific type (e.g. `IconProps`) if you want to be more explicit about props.

Secondly, I searched through your codebase, and I could not find _any_ uses of `ref` on icons. Is this overly-complicated requirement for icons really needed at all? Some commit messages mention "tooltips" but I don't see any refs being passed to the icon components.

Thirdly, your example wraps `forwardRef` around components that already forward refs. [`createSvgIcon`](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/blob/master/packages/material-ui-icons/src/utils/createSvgIcon.js) in `@material-ui/icons` already uses `forwardRef` for all the icons. Example icons like `AddBox` already forwards refs.

title: When no content the paging description is wrong
Direct updating of state in m-table-edit-row.js
body:
**Describe the bug**
On debugging I just saw that at one place in [`m-table-edit-row.js`](https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/blob/master/src/components/m-table-edit-row.js#L124) the state of the component is updated directly, which is discouraged in the [React Documentation](https://reactjs.org/docs/state-and-lifecycle.html#using-state-correctly).
The lines:
```
const newData = this.state.data
delete newData.tableData
```
since `newData` is defined by reference, not by value, one deletes the property tableData from the state directly. Or is this intended in this function?

1) allow to drag and drop rows from a group to another group -> this would trigger `onRowUpdate` function with `newData` having new group field value
2) do not hide a column if it is used for grouping, this can be made configurable via table or column options.

title: Decouple hidden column property from export
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I have columns that I want to be hidden but still exportable to csv. Prime use case for this is when your row has a primary id that makes little sense to show but would be beneficial to have in an excel document. In my case, the row is clickable to navigate to a specific page in the application that is driven by that primary id. For those that to choose to export, I would like for them to be able to copy and paste in their browser to get to that same page.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
After looking at the code, I feel like whether a column can be exported should be driven purely by the export boolean column property. I see though that by doing that, clients would likely be required to change code to maintain current behavior. To get around that we could always add something to the MaterialTableProps to drive whether hidden has any impact on whether it is exportable and have it default to the current behavior.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I'm open to any other ideas that solve the problem!

title: Default sort does not update when state variable updates
body:
**Describe the bug**
Say I have a table with 2 columns, `A` and `B`. I have a state variable called `isA`. When `isA === true`, I want to have a default sort by `A`. Conversely, when `isA === false`, I want to have default sort by `B`.

My columns look like this:
```javascript
[
  { field: 'A', title: 'A', defaultSort: isA && 'asc'},
  { field: 'B', title: 'B', defaultSort: !isA && 'desc'},
]
```
My table uses server side paging. When I update the `isA` variable I run the following:
```javascript
await this.tableRef.current.onQueryChange();
```
When this is complete and the table reloads, the default sort does not get set; rather, the same sort is in place but no sort is shown in the column headers.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Do as described above.

**Expected behavior**
The table should switch to the correct default sort when the table reloads.

title: The table is fully rerendered on parent state update since 1.53.0

**Expected behavior**
Before 1.53.0, you can navigate through the pages and see new rows appear. You can also change any table UI setting without loosing it,

title: When using function for Action, re-renders fully add/remove custom component
body: **Describe the bug** When adding an action implemented with a function (as opposed to an icon), the DOM seemingly fully removes and re-inserts the action element for each re-render. This obviously effects performance in an unacceptable way, causing all rows to briefly flash on any search or just plain loading. **To Reproduce** 1. Create a table with actions 2. Add action that uses a custom component ```jsx (rowData: any): any => ({ icon: () => tooltip: 'Google link', onClick: (event: any, rowData: any) => {} }), ``` 3. Search in Material table 4. See flickering of the image as it's continuously removed from the DOM **Expected behavior** The action only should re-render if the component changes. If you provide a function that returns an icon string (not a custom component), things behave correctly: ```jsx (rowData: any): any => { icon: 'fiber_new', tooltip: 'New updates!', iconProps: { color: 'secondary' }, onClick: (event: any, rowData: any) => {}, } ``` If I had to guess, it's something about this conditional in `m-table-action.js` ```jsx {typeof action.icon === "string" ? ( {action.icon} ) : ( ) } ```

title: localization: header.action and editable breaks my table
Header Checkbox: Styling to Work with Header Styling
body:
## Problem

When styling the header row (e.g. with a dark background), the selection checkbox becomes hard to see. It would be good if it was possible to style it.

## Proposal

I believe the simplest option would be an additional prop that would allow to style the checkbox (e.g. `selectAllCheckboxProps`) in line with the existing `selectionProps`.

An alternative would be not to allow individual styling, but to use the header style's `color` attribute as the header checkbox' color.

I believe the best possible solution would be to combine the two:
* if the header is styled, use the header style's `color` attribute as the checkbox color by default
* allow overriding this default with an explicit `selectAllCheckboxProps` attribute.

title: Strange actions width
No way to undertand if call to `onChangePage` was called directly or by `changePageSize`
body:
**Describe the bug**
In the last release [1.57.2](https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/releases/tag/v1.57.2)  you started to call `onChangePage` on `changePageSize`  and because of that we can't understand if we are in a new page or different pagination.

**To Reproduce**

We wanted to `scrollToTop` when page change, but we are also triggering this action now when we change the pageSize. 

**Expected behavior**

Maybe, if we pass `(page, pageSize)` to the `onChangePage` callback we will be able to understand when we are going to page 0 because the pageSize has changed or not.

title: Fix rows becoming locked when edit state is lost
body:
Part of editing mode is captured on the tableData field of the individual row's data object.
This field is overwritten when new row data is provided to the table.
Overwriting this field without dropping the lastEditingRow in
DataManager causes the entire table to become locked.

Add call to DataManager#changeRowEditing to drop all references to
editing rows. This prevents table from becoming locked when row data is
updated while editing.

https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/issues/1610

## Related Issue
#1610 
#1595
#1527
#1487 
#1446 

## Description
Prevent table from having all rows locked in edit mode when a row data change occurs by resetting the editing state captured in MaterialTable and DataManager.

## Related PRs
None

## Impacted Areas in Application
List general components of the application that this PR will affect:

* MaterialTable when editable is defined.

title: fix: remove tableData property from column in check phase
body:
## Related Issue
#491 
but actually many more like #1272 (partially solved) #1265

## Description
This PR introduces a fair equality check between columns when using remote data.
Without this pr, while checking in component did update if the columns changed, `this.props.columns` and `prevProps.columns` assumed different forms hence the deep equal returned false for the first time causing a rerendering of the entire table losing every setting set, and true at the second time.

This happens because through the data-manager the tableData property is added only in a second time to this.props.columns.

## Impacted Areas in Application
List general components of the application that this PR will affect:

* the entire material-table.js component is affected

title: Row-level loading when editing a field
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I've been noticing that the table locks all the records into a loading state whenever an edit is made at row level. While this can work very well for single edits, it can be frustrating when users need to edit multiple rows together (even with or without bulk editing).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to suggest adding row-level loading. Since editing a row should only re-render that set of values, the idea is to allow the users to continue editing the table even if one row is pending.

title: @babel/runtime is not listed as a dependency nor peer dependency
body:
The code in material-table/dist/index.js imports various modules from @babel/runtime, yet that package is not listed in dependencies or peer dependencies. A version of the babel runtime may be installed and hoisted through other packages or dependencies, but that does not ensure the correct version is installed.

My concrete failure is this:

> ./node_modules/material-table/dist/material-table.js
> Module not found: Can't resolve '@babel/runtime/helpers/assertThisInitialized' in '/home/runner/work/oecd-going-digital-toolkit/oecd-going-digital-toolkit/node_modules/material-table/dist'

I don't have @babel/runtime in my dependencies nor was it hoisted to the top-level node_modules by npm.

title: Management of Selections through Properties
body:
## Related Issue
#1603 

## Description
Allows for row selection to be managed from outside of the table itself.
Also properly fires `onRowSelected`, and will include whether or not the row selection has been changed to a true state, to allow for more granular operations.

Added parameter `checked` to `onRowSelected`, and `rowChecked` to `onSelectionChanged`.

## Impacted Areas in Application
List general components of the application that this PR will affect:

* Row selection
* `onRowSelected`
* `onSelectionChanged`

## Additional Notes
If a property for `selectedRows` is supplied, and neither the `onRowSelected` nor the `onSelectionChanged` property function alters the state value, the table will reflect the change, but the state won't change. If the property `externalSelection` is provided, it will not be able to change the selection whatsoever.

title: Selection functionality doesn't work correctly if selection state stored in Redux
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am storing the selection state of a material-table with selectable rows in Redux because I need it elsewhere in the app. This causes unexpected and incorrect behaviour of the checkboxes in the table, as detailed below and in the screenshots. 

Question: Is "material-table" generally compatible with Redux? Not sure if I am missing something, but storing state in Redux is a very common thing to do and I can't find anything relevant in the documentation on how to get this working correctly. 

**Set up**
A "material-table" table with selectable rows. Selecting a checkbox sets this selection state in the Redux store. The `checked` state of the checkbox (`selectionProps` >> `checked`) is driven by that same selection state in the Redux store - full code below but here's the relevant line: `selectionProps: (file) => ({ checked: !!reduxFileSelection && reduxFileSelection.includes(file.fileId) }),`. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Select "File 0" in the table (this sets the selection state in Redux)
2. Click on the "Fetch selected files" button (this clears the selection state in Redux)
3. Observe that the checkbox next to "File 0" is correctly unchecked (checkbox state set by selection state in Redux)
4. Now select "File "1".
5. Observe that the checkbox next to "File 1" is correctly checked, but the checkbox next to "File 0" is ALSO incorrectly checked

**Expected behavior**
In step 5 above I expect only the checkbox next to "File 1" to be checked.

**Screenshots**
![Material-table bug screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31520532/73351908-e5b3b780-4287-11ea-92f2-82c69a680af9.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31520532/73351554-28c15b00-4287-11ea-8182-384b0bda5c6b.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows
 - Browser: Observed in several browsers

**Additional context**
- React version: 16.9.0
- material-table version: 1.56.1

title: Same Key 'key-selection-cell' when selection and editable enabled
body:
**Describe the bug**
When selection and editable is on, clicking delete on a row will log a warning "Encountered two children with the same key, `key-selection-cell`. Keys should be unique so that components maintain their identity across updates. Non-unique keys may cause children to be duplicated and/or omitted — the behavior is unsupported and could change in a future version"

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Enable selection and editable
2. Click delete on a row


**Expected behavior**
The column containing the edit and delete actions need to have a unique key

Issue can he found in https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/blob/053408b30a97f6796ff736449109945813196fff/src/components/m-table-edit-row.js#L166

The key key-selection-cell should be changed to something like key-edit-cell

title: Allow to set all properties (primarily classes) and relay to underlying MUI table
body:
It would be great if overflowing props would be passed on to the underlying MUI table.

Setting `classes` is the most important to enable styling (for both table, tablerow, cell, ...), but also other.

Table styles can be worked around (a bit uglily) by styling descendants of a wrapper div with className on it, but it's far from ideal.

For cells, I have not found a solution. I would like to hide/transform cells (columns really) using responsive breakpoints in css, but without being able to set classes on specific columns/cells it seems really har.

For cells I believe passing through all non-handled properties of `columnDef` along with this.props would solve the issue, but there might be more elegant solutions.

https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/blob/3031eab70105df8d88c17984ca5cea878a9eae3f/src/components/m-table-cell.js#L117


Any short-term solutions to responsively hide columns would also be appreciated!

Thanks
/Victor

title: Don't hardcode date-io provider
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
`@material-ui/pickers` has a reason it uses a provider to provide a `@date-io` library instead of hardcoding one date provider. Not everyone uses the same date library and hardcoding one leads to unnecessary redundant date libraries and localization data being downloaded and differences in expected data types. This is the whole reason that `@date-io` exists instead of just using the date libraries directly.

material-table undoes this by depending on `@date-io/date-fns` directly. `@date-io/date-fns` and `date-fns` is downloaded and included in your bundles, even if you don't use date handling in Material Table. And if you already use `@material-ui/pickers` and have it setup with localization, then material-table undoes this and requires specifying localization info all over again.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I'd much prefer it if material-table didn't try interfering with the interface mui/pickers provides to users. And instead just allowed the user to specify the date utils provider at the root like mui/pickers wants.

**Additional context**
This would also cut down on the number of date utils instances that material table ends up creating.

Function giving tooltip text for Edit and Delete icons
body:
## Related Issue
This PR solves the issue #1762 

## Description
These code changes give an opportunity for the developer to override what will be in tooltip text for "Edit" and "Delete" buttons based on the row data. The usage of this can be:

    editable={{
        isEditable: rowData => rowData.name === "a",
        isDeletable: rowData => rowData.name === "b",
        editTooltip: rowData => rowData.name === "a" ? "Edit" : "Only rows with name 'a' can be edited",
        deleteTooltip: rowData => rowData.name === "b" ? "Delete" : "Only rows with name 'b' can be deleted",
        onRowAdd: newData => ...,
        onRowUpdate: (newData, oldData) => ... ,
        onRowDelete: oldData => ...
    }}

title: Show tooltip text over "Edit" and "Delete" buttons based on the row data

I am using [isEditable and isDeletable ](https://material-table.com/#/docs/features/editable)to determine wether the Edit and Delete buttons are disabled. I want to improve customer experience by showing text in the tooltip by explaining why is the button disabled.

**Proposed solution**
Extend the editable props for two new optional functions editTooltip and deleteTooltip taking rowData as an argument and return a string to be displayed as the tooltip text.

title: onQueryChange typescript definition
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/issues/383 the solution to forcing the table
to refresh is to call `onQueryChange`. The function implementation can accept a partial `Query` and even a `null` or `undefined`, so in javascript you can simply call `table.onQueryChange()`.
In typescript however, the declaration must accept a full `Query`, so a full query parameter must be passed.

See: https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/blob/master/types/index.d.ts#L39

**Describe the solution you'd like**
`onQueryChange` should accept an optional `Partial<Query<RowData>>`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
There should be a `forceRemoteUpdate` function, or this use-case of `onQueryChange` should be well documented.

title: Move actionsCellStyle to div container
body:
The `actionCellStyle` css style object is currently applied to the `TableCell` and not the child `<div>` element. Because of this, the styles do not allow formatting of the element such as `justifyContent: 'center'`  This simple edit moves the styles to the div. Hopefully this is the intended behavior. See [Issue #888](https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/issues/888)

## Related Issue
See [Issue #888](https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/issues/888)

## Description
Enable `actionCellStyle` to affect the styling of the cell's `<div>` directly.

## Related PRs
List related PRs against other branches:

branch | PR
------ | ------
other_pr_production | [link]()
other_pr_master | [link]()

## Impacted Areas in Application
List general components of the application that this PR will affect:

* [MTableBodyRow](https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/blob/master/src/components/m-table-body-row.js)

## Additional Notes
Very new to PRs so I apologize in advance if I've screwed something up.

body:
**Describe the bug**
If the first data you load into the table has x number of rows per page, you can change the rows per page to be amounts that are smaller or equal to x,  but you can't do higher.  

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Have the default pageSize set to 100 with server side pagination.  If you change the rows per page to be 25 or 50, it'll change and show the correct amount.  If you click on 200, even if the prop data now has 200 items, it still will only show the first 100.  Not sure what's happening to the rest of the items, since the data being passed into the prop is correct and the pageSize and rowsPerPage and page are all correct.

title: Column's defaultSort places column's arrow backwards
body:
Tested this using columns of strings, numbers, and datetimes (with custom sorting functions). 
The default sort does sort the data correctly, it just displays an arrow in the improper direction. 
Using `defaultSort="asc"` places a downwards arrow on the column when it should be an upwards arrow. And vice versa. 

Removing the defaultSort fixes the issue (the arrows work as intended if you click on the column).

title: Allow to specify row height when empty row in <TableRow />
body:
Currently, when the row is empty, the height is specified using fixed values between 49 and 36 depending on the padding. 

 const rowHeight = this.props.options.padding === 'default' ? 49 : 36; 

The solution would be to specify the height of the empty row using a class name.

<TableRow className={ this.props.options.padding === 'default' ? 'tableRowEmptyDefault : 'tableRowEmptyDense'} key={'empty-' + index} />

Finally, another option would be to specify the height for dense and default padding on the options.

I can understand how this would be desirable in the event that the content cannot fit on the page, however, its causing an issue when a field uses [react-select](https://react-select.com/home) for editing. The select drop down will bleed off the end of the table, and because the position of the drop-down box is absolute, a scroll bar will never appear and the content will be hidden from sight due to the `overflow-y: auto` style. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1608113/63100739-4f8c0f00-bf3d-11e9-912d-4dea41718466.png)

For now, I must apply an ugly fix of making the drop-down be `position: fixed` which expands the row vertically so it appears within the containing divs.

Is it possible to remove the `overflow-y: auto` surrounding the table, or would anyone be able to provide a better alternative fix for this?

title: Specify totalCount without remote data
body:
We are handling our data fetching & paginating manually (through Redux) and passing it to MaterialTable without a promise:

```
<MaterialTable
  ...
  title='Members'
  data={props.members}
/>
```

However, it appears that MaterialTable gets the total count from this array and doesn't let us specify. 

[This issue](https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/issues/281) had the same problem, and `remoteData` was added to allow the user to specify the `totalCount`, through a Promise.

However we have _zero_ need for using a Promise, and would like to pass `totalCount` straight to MaterialTable. Additionally a Promise doesn't work for us either, because the data is empty on the first render, and MaterialTable does not re call the Promise on data change. 

For example, this could be implemented in multiple ways:

Passing it as a normal prop:

```
<MaterialTable
  ...
  title='Members'
  data={props.members}
  totalCount={props.memberCount}
/>
```

or formatting data as an object, ie the object that Promise is supposed to return:

```
<MaterialTable
  ...
  title='Members'
  data={ { data: props.members, totalCount: props.memberCount, page: 0}
/>
```

title: Extremly slow perfomance while expanding grouped field with many results.
body:
First of all... Thank you for this excellent component! i found it very useful!

Bug report:
When expanding a grouped field, that contains many results, total rows count of the table only considers the first level of agrupation. So when you try to expand this first level, the totaly of the results are rendered at once. In my case I have "categories" containing over 5k rows each, so when i try to expand it, it takes more than 30 seconds to render the data.

I tried with 7000 rows of data, 4 columns, zero actions on each row, and defining grouping: true as the only Option for the MaterialTable Component.  Im using built-in data handling, not the remote data functionality.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Set: data={this.props.dataArray},  options={{ grouping:true }}
2. Drag and drop column header in order to group by.
3. Expand one of the grouped values.
4. When there is a significant amount of results it takes to long to render the rows, doesn't responds normally (the cursor gets buggy and no response browser warning is showned).

**Expected behavior**
It would be great to have the pagination on the amount of expanded rows, and not only on the first level of aggrupation.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 18.4
 - Browser [Chrome]
 - Version [75.0.3770 64bits]

Thx!

Documentation error for Action icon section
body:
Hi,

In the documentation action field https://material-table.com/#/docs/features/actions :

> icon | string or ReactElement|   | Icon of button from material icons or custom component

When i try to put a react component i get the error

> Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: object.

Error example :
```
              actions={[
                  rowData => ({
                  icon: <edit/>,
                  tooltip: 'Edit',
                  onClick: (event, rowData) => { console.log('CLICK') },
                }),
]} 
```
this works 
```
              actions={[
                  rowData => ({
                  icon: () => { return <Edit/> },
                  tooltip: 'Edit',
                  onClick: (event, rowData) => { console.log('CLICK') },
                }),
]} 
```

So maybe the documentation should be changed with :

> icon | string or **function**   | Icon of button from material icons or **custom rendering function**

Thanks

title: Grouping: Auto Expansion or workaround to Expand All
body:
Hello - 

Is there a flag similar to defaultExpanded but for for grouping rather than trees?

Alternatively, is there a way i could programatically invoke an expand on all rows?

Thanks in advance!

title: updating data through props causes all nested rows to collapse/ gives full render
body:
I do something like
render(){
<MaterialTable 
data={this.state.data} ...

whenever new data arrives from the sever (progress-data server initiated) I modify the data within the changed rows, and do a setState{data:data}).. this causes a full render and all expanded nested rows are collapsed..
Wats the best way to update rowdata without a full render?

title: Disable field and auto ID in editable when adding new row
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Request: Disable field and auto ID in editable when adding a new row.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I want to disable an ID field when adding a new row. That ID field should have the default value of the table row number(It should display 1 to 5 if I have 5 records).  If I click the add button, the ID field will be disabled with a value of 6.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
none

**Additional context**
none.

title: Need support to write unit test cases using jest
[Feature request] Event handler for group dragging
body:
I'd love to attach event handler when dragging column groups.

Main use case is to set query string based on group headers.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

In grouping options, allows an event handler like
```js
function onDropped(currentDroppedColumns) {}
```

title: Selectable Filtering options within filter row
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I'd like to allow users to select filtering options on a per column basis.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Allow for the filter icon adornment to be used as a Mui `<IconButton>` with a Mui `<Menu>` if a user gives the table an option `filteringSelect: true` (False by default?) within the tables `options` property. If this option is enabled, the filter icon will be clickable and generate a menu such as the following:

![Screen Shot 2019-04-09 at 1 24 35 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20094217/55821339-3ffe4480-5acb-11e9-83be-77c4235f60b3.png)

(Could use icons to clean up the text and make the menu more uniform), perhaps allowing the user to input their own filter options from the columns object.

Selecting different filters on each column would only return results from the data that meet all the criteria selected.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
No alternatives that cleanly meet the criteria above.

title: Keep track of column visibility state
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Column visibility state is not tracked between refresh of data. E.g. if paging a remote data source, each time you go to the next page, the columns shown/hidden reset.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Column visibility state to be tracked between data refreshes (e.g. when paging a remote data source, or when updating the local data source state after editing).

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
The only option at the moment is to disable column visibility selection.

Hi, crack, :). How to render a custom Filter?, I mean : I have a columns where I render different options, so I will want make a Filter where the user can select from this options and show the rows that have those options.

Best Regards

title: editable problem
body:
Hello everyone, someone knows if I can select the columns I want to edit.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29168528/54840034-cf71be00-4caa-11e9-9df1-510be755a102.png)

title: Toggle detailPanel on click of a cell
body: Currently there is options to use the preset buttons at the beginning of the table OR onRowClick to toggle the detailPanel. Is it possible to add a solution to allow the togglePanel function upon clicking of a cell (td or button within td) trigger this functionality?

title: Issues in the checkBox when you Filter twice
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you filter by some category and checked the result you got on onSelectionChange the info of row selected, However if you decide left those row checked and filter again, and you checked the result of the new filter, the onSelectionChange only offer the info of the new selected rows, BUT the Material-Table  show all the boxes selected. 

Material-Table version 1.24

**Expected behavior**
The solutions it could be unselected the before search or add the new search to the old one. 

My advice is add the new one to the old one, but the important is not have the mark in the checkbox are not inside the rowData because it cause issues.

Thanks in advance for check this 
This is a very good table 

Best Regards

title: How to filter date column by date range

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body:
Hi,
I'd like to override the default date filtering so that the user can select a start and end date, does the api allow for that and  how would I go about doing that? 
Thanks

title: Bulk editing
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
It is very annoying to have to click over and over to edit multiple rows.
There are many examples where users will have to edit each row in a table for user input data.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
There should be a way to open up editing on the entire table for bulk edits with a save and a cancel button.

title: Question: How to add count to grouping ?
body:
Is there any way to add count when grouping ?
We want to display number of aggregated items to the label.

title: Hide cell on details show
body:
Hey, awesome library thanks :)
Is it possible to hide the selected row when showing detail Panel?
I have duplicated data in detailPanel and it doesn't look so great.

title: Add validation to inline edit.
Get Filtered Data
body:
I'm trying to get the filtered data from the table, but I can't access it. How could I have access to it? I´ve searched in the doc but did not find anything about it. 
In react-table I could do something like this: 
`this.reactTable.getResolvedState().sortedData;`

It has something similar this react-table function?

title: Table Supports Density and Can Be Made "Dense"
body: The table supports MaterialUI Density so that it is easy to specify that the table is "Dense". Less white space in the table, preferred for desktop usage.

title: Add ability to show summation of value on tree data
body: **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** There should be a way to show a summation of a value on tree data. **Describe the solution you'd like** For example, if there is a table of currency amounts grouped by type, there should be a way to show a total in the group row. This should also apply to data that is grouped as well. EX (see screenshot): The first row shows a number ($2,345.99) for amount. There should be a way to automatically display a value that is a summation of all the `Amount` values in nested rows

title: Thin line at the bottom of the table
body:
**Describe the bug**
All `<td>` elements have a thin bottom line due to
```
.MuiTableCell-root{
   border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(224, 224, 224, 1);
}
```

This will cause a thin line under the table as the table navigation is contained in a `<td>` aswell. Especially with dark backgrounds this thin line is quite obvious and not nice. Currently, I use a css hack to hide the bottom line.

**To Reproduce**
See all examples and increase the border radius of table wrapper to e.g. 40px.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3856505/59161339-d6f27780-8ae1-11e9-9511-e83def7f5f4e.png)
The border radius of the wrapper is artificially increased to make the problem obvious.

title: Clicking on custom row doesn't trigger detail pannel.
Editing does not go away if "editable" value changes
body:
**Describe the bug**
I have onRowEdit as a conditional function that is altered via a state variable (when i press the enter button). When i click my edit button, the edit option becomes available. Then when I try to edit a row, then click the discard button, the field is still editable and If i try to click save, the app crashes.

**To Reproduce**
Watch GIF below

**Expected behavior**
When the editable prop is removed, the table should automatically discard the changes (as if clicking the X button on the row)

**Screenshots**
![Jun-06-2019 14-35-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15133828/59057625-c4b9d480-8868-11e9-8cb4-c9543122893a.gif)

title: Change the style of body.editRow.deleteText
body:
Hello,

First, thank you for this very useful library -I've been using it for a while and it's obvious a lot of work and thought has been put into it

I'm just trying to customise few things and I realised I couldn't change the colour/size of the text that appears when a row is about to be deleted ("Are you sure delete this row?" by default). I'm wondering if there is a way to change the style of that text.

Many thanks.

title: 'Select all' also selects disabled checkboxes / rows
body:
**Describe the bug**
A disabled checkbox can't be checked normally, but when you click 'select all', the disabled checkboxes are selected. The header bar indicates the selected rows as well.

**To Reproduce**
Add 
'selection: true', and something like
```
selectionProps: (rowData) => ({
   disabled: rowData.active === 'no'
})
``` 
Click the 'select all'.

**Expected behavior**
Disabled rows can never be selected, not on checkbox-click, and not with 'select all'

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3042408/59025124-c331e180-8853-11e9-8b82-d48a1dd0c15b.png)
(2 rows, disabled from selecting)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3042408/59025167-dfce1980-8853-11e9-8f54-4cf0cd867d0d.png)
(after 'select all')

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - MT version 1.39.0

body:

https://bundlephobia.com/result?p=dayjs@1.8.14

Thanks.

title: Need to be able to disable the confirm button when editing
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When editing, there needs to be a way to disable the confirm button - for instance if you don't want the user to input something empty - or meet some other criteria - for a certain column

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A function to provide the conditions in which the confirm button should be disabled

title: Is there a way to keep column hidden but still have its filters shown?
body:
We saw that searchable property allows for columns to be searched even when hidden but is it also true for remote data? 

Is there a way to let users select filters while keeping the column hidden?

Thanks for your input and great work.

title: Allow search field to be full width
Failed propType for Tooltip
body:
**Describe the bug**
Warning popping up in the console (on 1.39 and MUI 4.0.1):
```
Failed prop type: Invalid prop `children` supplied to `Tooltip`. Expected an element that can hold a ref. Did you accidentally use a plain function component for an element instead?
    in Tooltip (created by WithStyles(Tooltip))
    in WithStyles(Tooltip) (created by MTableToolbar)
    in div (created by ForwardRef(InputAdornment))
    in ForwardRef(InputAdornment) (created by Context.Consumer)
    in WithFormControlContext(ForwardRef(InputAdornment)) (created by WithStyles(WithFormControlContext(ForwardRef(InputAdornment))))
    in WithStyles(WithFormControlContext(ForwardRef(InputAdornment))) (created by MTableToolbar)
```

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.
```tsx
const tableIcons: Icons = {
  Add: () => <AddBox />,
  Check: () => <Check />,
  Clear: () => <Clear />,
  Delete: () => <DeleteOutline />,
  DetailPanel: () => <ChevronRight />,
  Edit: () => <Edit />,
  Export: () => <SaveAlt />,
  Filter: () => <FilterList />,
  FirstPage: () => <FirstPage />,
  LastPage: () => <LastPage />,
  NextPage: () => <ChevronRight />,
  PreviousPage: () => <ChevronLeft />,
  ResetSearch: () => <Clear />,
  Search: () => <Search />,
  SortArrow: () => <ArrowUpward />,
  ThirdStateCheck: () => <Remove />,
  ViewColumn: () => <ViewColumn />
};
const [geoHoldings, setGeoHoldings] = React.useState(
  toJS(viewModel.geoHoldings) // [{country: 'US', weight: 1}]
);
<MaterialTable
    icons={tableIcons}
    columns={[
        {
        title: "Market",
        field: "market",
        lookup: marketLookup,
        emptyValue: "-"
        },
        {
        title: "Region",
        field: "region",
        lookup: regionsLookup,
        emptyValue: "-"
        },
        {
        title: "Sub region",
        field: "subRegion",
        lookup: subRegionsLookup,
        emptyValue: "-"
        },
        {
        title: "Country",
        field: "country",
        lookup: countriesLookup,
        emptyValue: "-"
        },
        {
        title: "Weight",
        field: "weight",
        emptyValue: "0 %",
        type: "numeric",
        render: rowData => `${rowData.weight.toFixed(2)} %`
        }
    ]}
    data={geoHoldings}
    />
```
2. Navigate to it
3. See the error in the console

**Expected behavior**
Not having the message showing up

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Mac
 - Browser Chrome
 - Version 74.0.3729.169

title: Selection and Actions in the same Table Row
body: Allow tables to have rows with both selection Checkboxes and Action Buttons

title: Conditional detail panel options
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I want to be able to do the same thing as here https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/issues/609 as you are able to do for actions with detail panels.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
 I want to conditionally have a detail panel for a row based on the conditions of the row

title: Add onRowCancel function on editable tables
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I have a custom edit component that is a select dropdown with two options (A, and B)

My current idea is to have a state variable that is `currentRowOption` set to `''` initially. In my editComponent, before returning the select component, I set the state variable to the value of the row, if and only if the state variable is equal to `''`. I am able to to set the state variable back to `''` in the onRowUpdate function, but I need to be able to reset it if the editing is cancelled.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A function for `onRowCancel`

title: Provide ability to customize the component of a specific action
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I would like to customize the "add" action component only. Right now, a component can be provided for all actions. We cannot provide a different component for different action or can we ?

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Provide a way to customize specifically the "add" action or any kind of actions. Maybe provide the ability to specify a component for each kind of default actions?

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I considered validating action type before rendering my component using component props but couldn't find any props to achieve such a validation

title: new event onColumnsChange
body:
in continue of #517
**when** can I get list of selected columns in columnsButton?

this event can be fired after each change of visualization columns in mode columnsButton = true

title: MuiThemeProvider is not working when material version is updated to 4.0.2
Rows are modified with a new property tableData
body:
**Describe the bug**
Might be related to #269 as I have exactly the same pb.
When rendering rows in the grid, the property tableData is added to every row. This is a big problem with redux as its state MUST never be changed. Therefore, issue mentioning a readonly property may come from the fact that immutability frameworks like immer lock objects from the state for them not to be amended afterwards (as redux demands reducers and components to be pure).

**To Reproduce**
render a list of value in the grid 

**Expected behavior**
at the moment, before the rendering, business objects are directly manipulated by adding a tableData metadata on them:
```
{
  ...businessRow,
  tableData:{
    id:0
  }
}
```
what may be better instead would be to keep on behaving this way by default, but to permit to get the identifier from the row. If such an option is given, then, instead of getting/setting this "tableData" on the row itself, it can be recovered from a dictionary that is stored in the state.

This way, the input business row is never touched and stored as is in the object that is used by the rendered, and as a sibling property you have all the useful metadata for the rendering purpose.

As ideally, react component should be pure (not modifying its properties), this amendment would help a lot, at moreover it would permit your grid to work with react in any situation.

title: Publish a build using ESModules
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Using `material-table` bundles all of `@material-ui/core` because no build is published using ESModules.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Transpile the source with `modules: false` and publish that build as well with a `module` entry in your `package.json`

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Using a fork that is published under a different name

**Additional context**
Currently only a commonJS build is published. Since [you use named imports](https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/blob/a05fd97517a74ac8d52d0eb036433efe320de949/src/material-table.js#L2) this translates into webpack bundling all of `@material-ui/core`.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
We try to have our application following standards of Material UI, and it seems that the "add" button when the grid is in edit mode is not like most of typical material UI screens.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
What would make it consistent with most common screens with an "add" button would be a floating action button (Fab) at the bottom right like represented here: https://material-ui.com/components/buttons/#floating-action-buttons
If such a change is done as is:

Therefore there should be an option to permit the developer to choose whether this button appears like it used to appear: at the top right on the header bar, or as a typical material UI floating action button at the bottom right.

title: Exception on editing or deleting with multiple row selection enabled
body:
**Describe the bug**
Cannot edit or delete any items when selection is enabled.

This is because an array is passed into this function but the function expect a single row object:
```
function changeRowEditing(rowData, mode) {
      if (rowData) {
        rowData.tableData.editing = mode;

        if (this.lastEditingRow && this.lastEditingRow != rowData) {
          this.lastEditingRow.tableData.editing = undefined;
        }

        if (mode) {
          this.lastEditingRow = rowData;
        } else {
          this.lastEditingRow = undefined;
        }
      } else if (this.lastEditingRow) {
        this.lastEditingRow.tableData.editing = undefined;
        this.lastEditingRow = undefined;
      }
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a table with option "selection" set to true.
2. Provide a edit and delete action (like in: https://material-table.com/#/docs/features/editable).
3. Select any number of rows.
4. Click either the edit or delete action button in the top right.
5. See exception below.

**Expected behavior**
Should be able to edit or delete the row(s).

**Callstack**
```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set property 'editing' of undefined
    at DataManager.changeRowEditing (data-manager.js:400)
    at Object.onClick (material-table.js:472)
    at handleOnClick (m-table-action.js:60)

    at batchedUpdates$1 (react-dom.development.js:20439)

```
Thanks!

title: [Docs & Types] Importing icons from @material-ui/icons in TypeScript
body:
Importing icons with the way mentioned in tutorial will raise type errors.


```typescript
import { Icons } from 'material-table';
const tableIcons: Icons = {
  Add: AddBox,
  Check: Check,
  Clear: Clear,
  Delete: DeleteOutline,
  DetailPanel: ChevronRight,
  Edit: Edit,
  Export: SaveAlt,
  Filter: FilterList,
  FirstPage: FirstPage,
  LastPage: LastPage,
  NextPage: ChevronRight,
  PreviousPage: ChevronLeft,
  ResetSearch: Clear,
  Search: Search,
  SortArrow: ArrowUpward,
  ThirdStateCheck: Remove,
  ViewColumn: ViewColumn
};
// Type 'ComponentType<SvgIconProps>' is not assignable to type '(() => ReactElement<any, string ...
```

The correct way should be 
```typescript
const tableIcons: Icons = {
  Add: () => <AddBox />,
  Check: () => <Check />,
  Clear: () => <Clear />,
  Delete: () => <DeleteOutline />,
  DetailPanel: () => <ChevronRight />,
  Edit: () => <Edit />,
  Export: () => <SaveAlt />,
  Filter: () => <FilterList />,
  FirstPage: () => <FirstPage />,
  LastPage: () => <LastPage />,
  NextPage: () => <ChevronRight />,
  PreviousPage: () => <ChevronLeft />,
  ResetSearch: () => <Clear />,
  Search: () => <Search />,
  SortArrow: () => <ArrowUpward />,
  ThirdStateCheck: () => <Remove />,
  ViewColumn: () => <ViewColumn />
};
```

It seems that the type of icons are declared as `Add?: () => React.ReactElement<any>;`, which forces imports to be arrow functions, but the icons are exported from @material-ui/icons as `React.ComponentType<SvgIconProps>`

title: Applying column filter causes TablePagination to go out of range
body:
**Describe the bug**
Warning: Failed prop type: Material-UI: the page prop of a TablePagination is out of range (0 to 0, but page is 3).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a table with pagination and column filter
2. Fill the table with items resulting in more than one page
2. Go to the last page (with the pagination controls)
3. Apply a column filter resulting in less pages
4. This results in an error where pagination controls displays wrong number of pages + a script warning (see screenshots below). And the table goes blank.

**Expected behavior**
Alternative 1: Try to locate the closest sibling to what was previously the top row in the table and position the user on that corresponding page.
Alternative 2: Try to keep page position. E.g. If table had total 5 pages and user moved to page 4 then after applying the filter it resulted in total 3 pages the user would be moved to page 2.
Alternative 3: When applying column filter always move the user to page 1.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/795917/58546035-d534d400-8204-11e9-8840-aaa282f70646.png)

Look at developer tools to find typography styles have been overriden. **Expected behavior** Should not have duplicated material-ui style elements after including `MaterialTable` **Screenshots** **Environment** ``` npx create-react-app my-app --typescript ``` ``` "@material-ui/core": "^4.0.0", "material-table": "^1.37.0", ```

title: Feature localize date picker

body:
## Related Issue
#1241

## Description
Fixes the issue described in #1241, where detail panels, when used in combination with tree data, would cause the detail panel for the parent row to appear below all child rows of that parent. 
Now the parent detail panel will appear directly below the parent itself, as I believe is most natural, if for some reason you feel this is not the way it should work, I can add it as an option instead.

Also included in this pull request is a change to the ordering of the button icons for detail panels and tree data when used in combination.  
Previously the tree data icon would appear after the detail panel icon when the detail icon was set to appear on the left side.  
This felt very unnatural, especially if the detail icon was hidden on certain rows. 
If for some reason you feel this is not the way it should work, I can add it as an option instead. 

## Related PRs
None that I could find

## Impacted Areas in Application
* MTableBodyRow

(rowData) => ({
   icon: LockIcon,
   tooltip: 'Do smth',
   position: 'row',
   hidden: false,
   onClick: (e, rowData) => {console.log('do something')}
}),
```
And there is no action until I turned off selection.


If I will remove rowData => ({...my_action}) and make action as object, everything start working again.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Set table selection to true
2. Add action as a function (as in example in Conditionals Actions Example here https://material-table.com/#/docs/features/actions)
3. Profit, you not able to see your action

**Expected behavior**
We should able to see action button as a row action 


**Versions:**
    "material-table": "^1.57.2",
    "@material-ui/core": "4.9.2",
    "@material-ui/icons": "4.9.1",
    "@material-ui/lab": "^4.0.0-alpha.42",
    "@material-ui/styles": "^4.9.0",
    "react": "^16.9.0",

Any ideas? 

P.S. I forked main branch and see the same behavior in demo.

title: Update action types to support current icon usage
body:
## Description
The usage below works as it is supported in the code but when using TypeScript (I am on 3.7.x) it complains about the field labelled "icon" being incorrect. I have update the types based on [@material-ui/icons](https://github.com/mui-org/material-ui/blob/e168bc694a7c7a59e86990e2a3677938acf7e953/packages/material-ui-icons/scripts/create-typings.js#L24). Since this project does not include "@material-ui/icons", I just recreated the type in the same way they did it on line 24. 

`
import { Save } from "@material-ui/icons"
import { Action } from "material-table"

const saveAction: Action<{ id: number}> = {
  icon: Save,
  tooltip: "Save",
  onClick: () => { /* ... */},
}
`

title: Feature/add labels to inputs
body:
## Related Issue
This PR addresses the issues detailed in #1498 (Missing labels on edit components)
It also addresses #1375 (Missing label on Search input)

## Description

This PR adds aria-labels to each of the table-edit-fields, and also the toolbar's search input. This has no visual impact, but means that the column currently being edited is announced to screen reader users as they fill out the form. It also advises screen reader users on how to open the date/time pickers with the keyboard.


## Impacted Areas in Application

* toolbar (search input)
* table-edit-fields (all components)

## Additional Notes
Let me know if you have any questions about the PR!

title: Missing labels for edit components
body:
**Describe the bug**

When editing a row, the inputs rendered do not have any labels. Although context makes this OK for sighted users, anyone using a screen reader would not know what to input in the fields

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

On an editable table, center the 'edit' mode for a row. Turn on the screen reader, and tab to each input. Notice that only "edit text" or "button" etc is announced. Similarly, when in edit mode, you can use a browser extension tool like Axe or WAVE to run an accessibility report which will highlight the missing labels

**Expected behavior**

Every input has an aria-label which is announced to the user and clearly identifies the column (and if relevant, how to interact with the input)


**Additional context**
I will make a pull request for these changes shortly; hopefully you will consider accepting this :)

title: Case insensitive default sort
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
https://codesandbox.io/s/material-demo-0i09t
In the codesandbox example, default sorting is case sensitive on the name column so ahmet appears at bottom rather than top. It would be ideal to make default sorting configurable through a prop.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A boolean prop to enable/disable case sensitive default sort

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I considered custom sort but that requires user interaction once table is rendered. I would like the column pre-sorted upon render. I got it to work with default sorting after introducing toUpperCase() in the else block of sort function in data-manager.js

title: Columns labeled as 'numeric' have right align when used as a group label.
body:
**Describe the bug**
If you enable grouping on a table and you use a label marked with the type 'numeric' as the group by label, the group selection interface will be right aligned. (Likely due to how numeric columns themselves are right aligned.)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a column with the field "type" set to "numeric"
2. Enable the option 'grouping' on the table
3. Choose the previously created "numeric" column as the grouping label
4. See that the group tabs are awkwardly on the right side of the table

**Expected behavior**
The group tabs should be aligned to the left, irrespective of the type of the column used to group by.

**Screenshots**
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7662568/71575024-4ef1b080-2ab9-11ea-8652-bf228d461f32.PNG)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Browser: Firefox
 - Version [e.g. 22]: 71.0

title: Column based grouping mapping callback
body:
Often raw values are not suitable for grouping -- it would be great to have a callback that was used to map raw field values to the values to be grouped by.
For example:
```
      ...  { title: "Price", field: "cost",
                  groupBy: rowData => round(rowData.cost / 10)}

``````
This would group by the cost rounded to ten dollars.
Note that the groupings may be a different type than the original field -- for example, instead of the above, I could return strings like "Less than $10", "Between $10 and $100", and "Over $100".

title: Support for array column type and export csv
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
One the fields I'd like to render is an array field. I currently render the column using a custom render method which works fine. The problem comes form the default export option. When I export it to csv, the array field gets exported with commas in it and no quotation around the value, which the csv interprets as a new column. 
As an example: 
```json
data = [
    { "id": 1, "tags": ["tag1", "tag2"] },
    { "id": 2, "tags": ["tag2",] },
]
```
In the export this comes out as
```csv
"id","tags"
"1",tag1,tag2
"2",tag2
```

For some reason all fields are wrapped with quotation except the array field which can use it the most.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A quick fix would be to wrap all exported csv cells in quotations (including the array fields) so the csv can be interpreted properly.

Another solution is described in #1318 

In general adding support for array data columns would be nice!

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
An option is to override the `exportCsv` options but that would be too cumbersome for one column.

title: Add the ability to chose the variant of the search text field
body:
## Related Issue
#1291 (Partially)

## Description
Added the ability to chose the variant of the search field by providing **searchFieldVariant** under the **options** props.
The possible values are _standard_, _filled_ , _outlined_.
If not provided the default value is standard

## Example usage
`
<MaterialTable>
...
  options={{
    searchFieldVariant: 'outlined',
   }}
</MaterialTable>
`
![search_field_variant](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23128418/71519863-f0161680-28c1-11ea-9564-dee6bcc117e4.png)

## Impacted Areas in Application

* MTableToolbar component
* Demo application which was updated to showcase the change

## Additional Notes
There was also an attempt to provide the ability to chose variant for the filter fields. The problem was with the lookup filter which did not render the correct variant but kept using the standard one as shown in the picture below. 
![problem_lookup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23128418/71519908-2784c300-28c2-11ea-8716-2b4c5c34bb44.png)
This might be related to #1061. Due to this inability to change the variant of the lookup filter, no change was made to the other filters to ensure consistency

Cells should be clickable - bringing up the edit component
[This](https://codesandbox.io/s/github/tannerlinsley/react-table/tree/master/examples/editable-data) is a good example of what we are looking for functionality-wise. It would of course have to fit the Material theme

title: Reduce the bundle size
body:
I have analyzed with `source-map-explorer` the build size of my application that uses material-table, and I noticed that it was responsible of a large part of the size.
One issue is that it imports all material-ui components instead of just the ones needed, the other issue is the react-beautiful-dnd dependencies (almost half of the bundle size).

1. For the first issue i think we can use path imports for the materialui dependencies :  
Instead of 
```
import { Button, TextField } from '@material-ui/core';
```
we can do :  
```
import Button from '@material-ui/core/Button';
import TextField from '@material-ui/core/TextField';
```
More information [in the material ui documentation](https://material-ui.com/guides/minimizing-bundle-size/)

2.  For the second issue I am not sure how it can be done, but there could be a way to opt-out of the draggable feature, and those who wants it needs to include react-beautiful-dnd in their dependencies.

There are probably other solutions.

What do you think ?

Thank you very much.

title: Toggle Selection Feature for Leaf Nodes in a Tree View
body:
When rendering a Tree view it would be extremely useful if leaf nodes (those nodes without any children of their own) could be configured to NOT display the Selection checkboxes, while still allowing Parent / Non-Leaf nodes to have the Selection checkboxes enabled.

Specifically, when the Selection feature is enabled (in the Options object) for a Tree each node of that tree is assigned a checkbox. My feature request is for a flag that toggles OFF checkboxes for leaf nodes - that is, for those nodes that do not have children. This means only parent nodes can be selected.

Hopefully this feature request makes sense?

title: crash in componentWillReceiveProps when changing data shape while sorted
body:
**Describe the bug**
This is perhaps an overly-specific use-case, but a bug nonetheless...
I have a table with a free action button that transposes the data in the table:  on clicking the action button, it recalculates the rows and headers data which are stored in the parent state, and delivers it to the `MaterialTable` component.  Everything works fine until I sort one of the last columns in the table.  If the number of columns in the pre-transposed table is greater than the number of post-transposed columns, and if the "currently sorted" column no longer exists after transpose, then the `sortList` method in `data-manager.js` fails in `UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps` because there is no longer a column there, and the component crashes at line 421 below

https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/blob/695f95c3b3c8fa70cc3e2fe56e7d649b2eae0ca6/src/utils/data-manager.js#L417-L421

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'customSort' of undefined
  at sortList(./node_modules/material-table/dist/utils/data-manager.js:633:1)
  at sortData(./node_modules/material-table/dist/utils/data-manager.js:886:1)
  at getRenderState(./node_modules/material-table/dist/utils/data-manager.js:134:1)
  at UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps(./node_modules/material-table/dist/material-table.js:424:1)
```

If I wrap the table in an Error boundary and force it to rerender, it works fine.

**To Reproduce**
https://codesandbox.io/s/zen-moser-b802x

(note, the console error is not very informative there as it is trumped by an apparent error in `react-beautiful-dnd`)

**Expected behavior**
deriving state from props should not crash the component, even if the shape of the `props.data` and `props.columns` has changed

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Browser : Chrome
- react version 16.8.6
- material-table version 1.40.1

title: Add support for default and specified classNames for columns and rows
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Yes, styling the columns and rows is extremely difficult and must rely on hacky CSS selectors.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to see `<MaterialTable rowClass={} and columnClass={} ... />`. In addition I would like to see support for specifying (and overiding) a column class directly with the column definition. While the `cellStyle` is supported within the column definition, it is not efficient to have to repeat the same information for multiple columns.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I have resorted to elaborate (and fragile/hacky) CSS selectors to implement CSS styles.

**Additional context**
n/a

title: Add support for className
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
While there is support for `<MaterialTable style={{}} ... />`, there does not seem to be support for `<MaterialTable className={} ... />`.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I want to be able to define a CSS class name using `<MaterialTable className={classes.myTable} ... />` or `<MaterialTable className='myTable' ... />`..

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Wrapping the `<MaterialTable />` in a `<div>` and using CSS to find it that way (hacky).

actions={[

]}

`Note that if you pass a string instead, no prop type failure, but the icon doesn't show up. Instead you just see the first couple of letters of whatever you type. But again, no prop type failure. But I don't want text, I want an icon.`

`Note that I just copy and pasted the starter code, and all I changed was this action prop`

`Note that "Edit" is from the following starter code (trimmed down for brevity)`
```
import Edit from '@material-ui/icons/Edit'

const tableIcons = {
  ...
  Edit: forwardRef((props, ref) => <Edit {...props} ref={ref} />),

title: set defaultSort programmatically
Duplicated `key-selection-cell` on row deletion
body:
**Describe the bug**
Basically the same behaviour described on #1584 but during deletion.
In presence of multiple rows, with ```editable``` mode on, if I try to delete something - independently a set or a single row - I receive this exception:
> Warning: Encountered two children with the same key, `key-selection-cell`. Keys should be unique so that components maintain their identity across updates. Non-unique keys may cause children to be duplicated and/or omitted — the behavior is unsupported and could change in a future version.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Populate the table with some data
2. Enable the `edit` mode
3. Try to delete a row by clicking on its own proper action - the single one action, not the multiple ```FreeAction``` one
4. Check the console

**Expected behavior**
The issue shouldn't be thrown by clicking on a single delete action of a row. The row keys should be dynamically generated, i.e. ```key={`key-selection-cell-${SOME_INDEX}`}```.
Or better the PR suggested on #1583 could solve the issue.

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot 2020-04-27 at 11 58 34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12085296/80359666-70ec1b80-887e-11ea-9f40-d02fa483dd37.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: OS X 10.15.4
 - Browser chrome
 - Version 84

**Additional context**
This is causing me many troubles, especially in the current Tree Data scenario in which I'm working on. The duplicated keys are preventing the table to set its own internal state properly after a mass rows deletion - the table still stuck in a (```disabled```?) state (check the above screenshot).
I think that this is a consequence of the main issue, which occurs even if parent/child relations between elements are not present.

title: Ability to sort lookup field alphabetically
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. 
I'm always frustrated when I need to sort a lookup field alphabetically and it defaults to the order of properties in the object.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The problem occurs [here](https://github.com/mbrn/material-table/blob/34fb0c3a065d531ea6f67ed5bf2ee15c9b73ca0a/src/components/m-table-edit-field.js#L26). The only way to sort a `<Select>` element's `MenuItem`s is to provide it with the `MenuItem ` in the order you wish for them to be displayed. Since `Object.keys()` is unordered, and the keys for the `lookup` object are numbers, the `MenuItem`s are rendered by their property names and not by the property contents.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I've considered using a component other than material-table, since it does not support this functionality.

**Additional context**

Given:
```
lookup = {
   0: "B",
   2: "D",
   3: "A",
   1: "C"
}
```

expecting to see:

```
<Select>
    <MenuItem>A</MenuItem>
    <MenuItem>B</MenuItem>
    <MenuItem>C</MenuItem>
    <MenuItem>D</MenuItem>
</Select
```

instead saw:

```
<Select>
    <MenuItem>B</MenuItem>
    <MenuItem>C</MenuItem>
    <MenuItem>D</MenuItem>
    <MenuItem>A</MenuItem>
</Select
```

title: Detect click on Edit/Delete buttons
body:
I have a table whose rows are updating automatically every certain number of seconds.
When I click on `Edit` or `Update` a row, if I wait that number of seconds, that data update spoils my whole table and prevents me from using it any more.

Table
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11148519/72389118-85693580-371f-11ea-8ef0-84fc01f8d8f5.png)


Just after clicking:
![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11148519/72388997-40dd9a00-371f-11ea-9c60-a5d117a04485.PNG)

A few moments later, when the row I'm trying to edit/delete is modified:
![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11148519/72389010-4dfa8900-371f-11ea-8ff4-adb5b502d91e.PNG)

I was hoping `onSelectionChange` to help me, but it doesn't.
I can successfully prevent the data update using `onRowClick`, but when clicking on `Edit`/`Delete` `onRowClick` is not automatically triggered (so the user would need to actually click in the table before clicking on one of the buttons).

Am I missing a way to detect when `Edit`/`Delete` are clicked?
Thanks

title: SSR server/client mismatch error, related to react-beautiful-dnd dependency
body:
**Describe the bug**

react-beautiful-dnd [exports resetServerContext](https://github.com/atlassian/react-beautiful-dnd/blob/master/src/index.js#L11) that allows for it to be used with SSR. The function clears the server context which resolves errors like:

> "Warning: Prop data-react-beautiful-dnd-draggable did not match. Server: "7" Client: "0"

material-table includes react-beautiful-dnd as a dependency, but does not export the resetServerContext. If a project includes material-table and also includes react-beautiful-dnd, but the _versions do not match_ calling the function `resetServerContext` imported from react-beautiful-dnd does not reset the context on the module instance used by material-table.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Clone repo: https://github.com/kyle-mccarthy/react-material-table-ssr-issue
2. yarn install
3. yarn dev
4. Load localhost:3000 with dev tools open
5. See error similar to `Warning: Prop \`data-react-beautiful-dnd-draggable\` did not match. Server: "1" Client: "0"` 

**Expected behavior**

To get the expected behavior:

1. Continue from the reproduction steps
2. Run: `yarn remove react-beautiful-dnd && yarn add react-beautiful-dnd@11.0.3`
3. yarn dev
4. Load page with dev tools open 
5. No longer an error

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: macos
 - Browser: chrome
 - Version: 79.0.3945.79

**Additional context**
I think the best solution to this would be for material-table to re-export the `resetServerContext` function from `react-beautiful-dnd`. This probably will work the best since it doesn't require devs to lock their react-beautiful-dnd dep to the same version that material-table is using.

If that is an acceptable solution, I have a [fork](https://github.com/kyle-mccarthy/material-table) and can open a PR.
